text: Norway was represented by duo Dollie de Luxe, with the song "Lenge leve livet" at the 1984 Eurovision Song Contest, which took place on 5 May in Luxembourg City. "Lenge leve livet" was chosen as the Norwegian entry at the Melodi Grand Prix on 7 April. ==Before Eurovision== === Melodi Grand Prix 1984 === The MGP was organised by broadcaster NRK and was held at the Château Neuf in Oslo, hosted by Sissel Keyn Lodding. Ten songs took part in the final, with the winner chosen by voting from five juries separated by age. It was one of the closest MGPs, with only 3 points separating the top four songs. {| class="sortable wikitable" style="margin: 1em auto 1em auto; text- align:center" ! colspan="5" |Final – 7 April 1984 |- bgcolor="#CCCCCC" ! Draw ! Artist ! Song ! Points ! Place |- |1 | align="left" |Beate Jacobsen | align="left" |"Strand Hotel" |43 |2 |- | 2 | align="left" |Ina Tangerud | align="left" |"Dine øyne" | 15 |8 |- |3 | align="left" |Ove Thue | align="left" |"Lenge siden nå" |11 |10 |- |4 | align="left" |Inger Lise Rypdal | align="left" |"Vindar" |42 |3 |- style="font-weight:bold; background:gold;" |5 | align="left" |Dollie de Luxe | align="left" |"Lenge leve livet" |45 |1 |- |6 | align="left" |Ellen Nikolaysen | align="left" |"Opus" |25 |6 |- |7 | align="left" |Hilde Heltberg | align="left" |"Ditt smil" |17 |7 |- |8 | align="left" |Nick Borgen | align="left" |"La musikken leve" |35 |5 |- |9 | align="left" |Cathy Ryen | align="left" |"Jeanne d'Arc" |15 |8 |- |10 | align="left" |Silhouette | align="left" |"A-oa-oa-oa" |42 |3 |} {| class="wikitable collapsible collapsed" style="margin: 1em auto 1em auto; text-align:center;" |- ! colspan="8" |Detailed Jury Votes |- !Draw !Song !Under 20 !20-30 !30-40 !40-50 !Over 50 !Total |- | 1 || align="left" | "Strand Hotel" || 6 ||12|| 10 || 8 || 7 || 43 |- | 2 || align="left" | "Dine øyne" || 4 || 2 || 3 || 3 || 3 || 15 |- | 3 || align="left" | "Lenge siden nå" || 1 || 1 || 1 || 4 || 4 || 11 |- | 4 || align="left" | "Vindar" || 10 || 10 ||12|| 5 || 5 || 42 |- | 5 || align="left" | "Lenge leve livet" ||12||7||8||10||8||45 |- | 6 || align="left" | "Opus" || 2 || 5 || 6 || 6 || 6 || 25 |- | 7 || align="left" | "Ditt smil" || 8 || 3 || 2 || 2 || 2 || 17 |- | 8 || align="left" | "La musikken leve" || 5 || 8 || 5 || 7 || 10 || 35 |- | 9 || align="left" | "Jeanne d'Arc" || 3 || 6 || 4 || 1 || 1 || 15 |- | 10 || align="left" | "A-oa-oa-oa" || 7 || 4 || 7 ||12||12|| 42 |- |} == At Eurovision == On the night of the final de Luxe performed 5th in the running order, following Spain and preceding the United Kingdom. At the close of voting "Lenge leve livet" had picked up 29 points (the highest an 8 from Sweden), placing Norway 17th of the 19 entries. The Norwegian jury awarded its 12 points to Denmark. ===Points awarded by Norway=== {| class="wikitable" |- |width=20% bgcolor="gold"|12 points|| |- |width=20% bgcolor="silver"|10 points|| |- |width=20% bgcolor="#CC9966"|8 points|| |- |width=20%|7 points|| |- |width=20%|6 points|| |- |width=20%|5 points|| |- |width=20%|4 points|| |- |width=20%|3 points|| |- |width=20%|2 points|| |- |width=20%|1 point|| |- |} ===Points awarded to Norway=== {| class="wikitable" |- |+Points awarded to Norway (final) |- !width=20%|12 points !width=20%|10 points !width=20%|8 points !width=20%|7 points !width=20%|6 points |- | valign="top" | | valign="top" | | valign="top" | * | valign="top" | * | valign="top" | * |- !width=20%|5 points !width=20%|4 points !width=20%|3 points !width=20%|2 points !width=20%|1 point |- | valign="top" | | valign="top" | | valign="top" | * | valign="top" | * * | valign="top" | * |- |} ==See also== *Norway in the Eurovision Song Contest *Eurovision Song Contest 1984 == References == Category:Countries in the Eurovision Song Contest 1984 Category:Norway in the Eurovision Song Contest Eurovision Eurovision
